Hello May, 

 

I’ve copied in @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  to review/confirm the rental terms. 

 

In the meantime, please note the comments below. I also want to mention that the General Terms & Conditions of the Lease differ from the previous agreement. While it’s advisable that we ask JAFZA to include the same terms and conditions signed previously, they may reject it considering these are their general terms. I’ve indicated the major ones below.  

 

*	Second Party/Tenant: the email address should be updated as it still refers to mailmac.net
*	Clause 1.4, Term: the lease is being renewed for a period of 5 years – is this confirmed?

*	Second Party/Tenant: the email address should be updated as it still refers to mailmac.net
*	Clause 1.4, Term: the lease is being renewed for a period of 5 years – is this confirmed?
*	Clause 1.5, Rent: the rent details need to be validated/confirmed. 
*	Clause 1.6, Review Dates: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable for the duration of the lease term.
*	Clause 1.7, Rent Review Cap: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable for the duration of the lease term.
*	Clause 1.11, Additional Covenants: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable by including “0”, similar to the previous agreement. 
*	Annexure 1: the rent details need to be validated/confirmed. 
*	General Terms & Conditions

	*	Clause 13, Alienation Generally: this provision has been amended so that now, any change in the shareholding of the Tenant shall be deemed to be an assignment of this Lease and the Lessor shall have the right to charge a consent fee and/ or require a new lease to be entered into at the then market rent and conditions – not agreed; we should request that this be deleted and the clause revised as per the wording agreement in the previous agreement. 
	*	Clause 15, Insurance Provisions: this section should be reviewed internally for reference and compliance purposes @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . 
	*	Clause 27, Renewal: the notice period should be revised from “24 months” to “6 months”, as per the previous agreement. 

 

I look forward to receiving the required feedback.

In the meantime, please note the comments below. I also want to mention that the General Terms & Conditions of the Lease differ from the previous agreement. I’ve indicated the major ones below.  

 

*	Second Party/Tenant: the email address should be updated as it still refers to mailmac.net

Hello May, 

 

I’ve copied in @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  to review/confirm the rental terms. 

 

In the meantime, please note the comments below. I also want to mention that the General Terms & Conditions of the Lease differ from the previous agreement. While it’s advisable that we ask JAFZA to include the same terms and conditions signed previously, they may reject it considering these are their general terms. I’ve indicated the major ones below.  

 

*	Second Party/Tenant: the email address should be updated as it still refers to mailmac.net
*	Clause 1.4, Term: the lease is being renewed for a period of 5 years – is this confirmed?
*	Clause 1.5, Rent: the rent details need to be validated/confirmed. 
*	Clause 1.6, Review Dates: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable for the duration of the lease term.
*	Clause 1.7, Rent Review Cap: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable for the duration of the lease term.
*	Clause 1.11, Additional Covenants: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable by including “0”, similar to the previous agreement. 
*	Annexure 1: the rent details need to be validated/confirmed. 
*	General Terms & Conditions

	*	Clause 13, Alienation Generally: this provision has been amended so that now, any change in the shareholding of the Tenant shall be deemed to be an assignment of this Lease and the Lessor shall have the right to charge a consent fee and/ or require a new lease to be entered into at the then market rent and conditions – not agreed; we should request that this be deleted and the clause revised as per the wording agreement in the previous agreement.

Subject: RE: Renewal Notification for SR Number: 21570826 for 8198 and REAL FZE and Lease No: 3917752

 

Hello May, 

 

I’ve copied in @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  to review/confirm the rental terms. 

 

In the meantime, please note the comments below. I also want to mention that the General Terms & Conditions of the Lease differ from the previous agreement. While it’s advisable that we ask JAFZA to include the same terms and conditions signed previously, they may reject it considering these are their general terms. I’ve indicated the major ones below.  

 

*	Second Party/Tenant: the email address should be updated as it still refers to mailmac.net
*	Clause 1.4, Term: the lease is being renewed for a period of 5 years – is this confirmed?
*	Clause 1.5, Rent: the rent details need to be validated/confirmed. 
*	Clause 1.6, Review Dates: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable for the duration of the lease term.
*	Clause 1.7, Rent Review Cap: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable for the duration of the lease term.
*	Clause 1.11, Additional Covenants: for the avoidance of doubt, we should clarify that this clause is not applicable by including “0”, similar to the previous agreement. 
*	Annexure 1: the rent details need to be validated/confirmed. 
*	General Terms & Conditions

	*	Clause 13, Alienation Generally: this provision has been amended so that now, any change in the shareholding of the Tenant shall be deemed to be an assignment of this Lease and the Lessor shall have the right to charge a consent fee and/ or require a new lease to be entered into at the then market rent and conditions – not agreed; we should request that this be deleted and the clause revised as per the wording agreement in the previous agreement.
